keel.Algorithms.Fuzzy_Rule_Learning.Genetic.ClassifierSLAVEv0

Class myDataset

  • java.lang.Object
    • keel.Algorithms.Fuzzy_Rule_Learning.Genetic.ClassifierSLAVEv0.myDataset

  • public class myDataset
extends java.lang.Object

    It contains the methods to read a Classification/Regression Dataset

    Since:
    JDK 1.6

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Written by Alberto Fernández (University of Granada) 01/01/2007, Modified by Francisco José Berlanga (University of Jaén) 09/12/2008

      • readClassificationSet

        public void readClassificationSet(java.lang.String datasetFile,
                                  boolean train)
                           throws java.io.IOException

        It reads the whole input data-set and it stores each example and its associated output value in local arrays to ease their use.

        Parameters:
        datasetFile - String name of the file containing the dataset
        train - boolean It must have the value "true" if we are reading the training data-set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there ocurs any problem with the reading of the data-set

      • readRegressionSet

        public void readRegressionSet(java.lang.String datasetFile,
                              boolean train)
                       throws java.io.IOException

        It reads the whole input data-set and it stores each example and its associated output value in local arrays to ease their use.

        Parameters:
        datasetFile - String name of the file containing the dataset
        train - boolean It must have the value "true" if we are reading the training data-set
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If there ocurs any problem with the reading of the data-set

      • getType

        public int getType(int variable)

        It returns the type for the attribute "variable"

        Parameters:
        variable - int attribute id (position of the attribute)
        Returns:
        int 1 if "variable" is an integer attribute; 0 if "variable" is a real attribute; 2 if "variable" is a nominal attribute; 0 (real) by default;
